intro: Alangium chinense subsp. pauciflorum, commonly known as Chinese alangium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Berberidaceae. It is characterized by its evergreen shrub form, with lanceolate leaves that are dark green and glossy. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by red berries that contain several seeds. It is native to Southeast Asia and is often found in moist, shaded forest environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in some regions for horticultural and traditional uses.
